metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
May 1st.
Dear Sidney,
I got your letter 31. I have seen Stanton Griffis. He wanted
me to go out as a property owner. I said I must go for him in a job. He said
he will go to Washington and see what he can do and will let me know next
Sunday May 6 th. I hope it works. He claims if I go for him I will go by
boat on the next shipment which he has no idea what the date will be. I hope
I hear something really definate soon. It sounds possible but far from sure.
I have my fingers crossed.
I saw Fighting Lady with Ellen the other night and thinks it s a
great picture. One the way back being unable to get a taxi Ellen and I were
walking up Lexington Avenue, one of my ear rings fell off and rolled through
a grating on the side walk. It was the air vent for the subway. We reported
the loss to the ticked taker at the booth. He told me to come back in the
morning and he would have a man there to hunt for it on a step ladder. Ire-
turned and was then told two men had already searched and had not found it.
I went to the Police Station and reported the loss, have advertised in the paper
have offered to reward etc. etc. The theory is that children with sticks and chew
wing gum make a habit of finding things in drains which has probably happened
this time. The point of the story however is this. The ear ring are a pair
just bought by me a Cartier.The bill is not even paid yet and I have no
insurance coverage. The funny part of the tale is that I bought the ear rings
in order to make Cartier condicend to ingrave the date on the back of the
[End Page 1]
Geneva watch I bought for you and which they had refused to do because it was 'nt
a Cartier watch. Ellen jockingly said you must spend a thousand dollars and buy
something in order to have them do that ingraving. For fun we looked at ear rings
- I fell for a pair,and Ellen the perfect saleswoman helpdthe sale along no
end. I emerged with a resplendent pair of 14kt.gold knot ear rings studded
at intervals with saphires and diamond. Really a wonderful looking heavy
pair of globs- and now there it is one down the drain and already lost.
I believe my good luck that persued me for six months and the lucky star
that guided me is about to sign off for a while and maybe this is what is
comming to me for a bit only perhaps the beginning. If it is nothing
more serious however than a pair of ear rings I wont mind.
Honey found a mouse to-night under the radiator and the
excitement was like Medway in the kitchen before we go to bed. He flopped
around the floor with that fat stomach flat ,and all paws stretched out and
the usual high squweeks of pleasure while the children howled with excitement
and could n't finish their supper.
I am off to bed now darling and only wish I were with you out
there with you instead of here.
I haven't gotten down to Medway.I know it must look like a jungle.
I think we should leave it as is till we know what we want to do.
We have no cook and Rose is doing it.
Loads of love-
Gertrude Legendre
Ellen sends [illegible] these pictures of her suit you sent her-
Has n't caught a beaux yet despite a exposed mid rif - so
she says-
P.S. Jimmie Legendre [Anne's child] was killed
April 8th in action Germany -
[End Page 2]
